prompt: Photorealistic macro shot of a historian's hand holding a magnifying glass over an extremely rare, tarnished brass American Civil War Confederate officer's button (CSA marked) resting on an aged, leather-bound reference book. The button shows intricate detail and patina. Soft, focused lighting highlights the textures. Shallow depth of field blurs the book's text in the background. Composition places the button and magnifying glass slightly off-center to the right, leaving space on the left for text overlay. Professional, informative style. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: identification-rare-military-buttons-image-1.png

prompt: A wide, top-down flat lay composition showcasing a diverse collection of rare military buttons from different eras and nations (e.g., WWI British infantry, WWII German Kriegsmarine, early US Militia) meticulously arranged on a weathered dark wood surface. Antique calipers, a jeweler's loupe, and a small notebook lie beside the buttons. Soft, even lighting from above, mimicking studio lighting for documentation. Highly detailed, sharp focus across the entire arrangement. Professional catalog photography style. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: identification-rare-military-buttons-image-2.png

prompt: An expert numismatist's hands carefully comparing a rare 18th-century pewter military button (possibly French or British) to a detailed engraving in an open, antique reference guide titled 'Military Buttons of the Ages'. The scene is set on a cluttered historian's desk with warm, directional light coming from a vintage brass desk lamp on the left, casting soft shadows. Focus is sharp on the button and the book illustration. Background shows blurred stacks of books and maps. Atmospheric, scholarly feel. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: identification-rare-military-buttons-image-3.png

prompt: Close-up, slightly angled view of three tarnished, verdigris-patinated brass military buttons (e.g., Napoleonic era eagle motif) still firmly attached to a fragment of heavily weathered, dark blue wool uniform fabric. The fabric shows fraying and age. Natural, diffused window light illuminates the scene from the side, emphasizing the texture of the metal and cloth. Focus is sharpest on the central button, with slight fall-off towards the edges. Evokes historical context and preservation. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: identification-rare-military-buttons-image-4.png

prompt: A clean, professional shot capturing a section of a modern museum display case dedicated to rare military buttons. Several distinct buttons (e.g., a US Navy button from 1812, a WWI trench art button, a silver officer's dress button) are individually mounted and illuminated by focused mini spotlights against a dark, non-reflective velvet background. Small, discreet identification labels are visible below each button. The composition uses the landscape format to show the linear arrangement within the brightly lit, secure glass case. Museum exhibition photography style. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: identification-rare-military-buttons-image-5.png
